title: Being unbanned
body: I recently got permabanned for toxicity(big rip). I have had that account for almost 7 years now and over that 7 years I have spent a decent amount of money on that game.  Now its just sitting there, do anyone think Riot will unban people like me at some random time? I read somewhere that riot did some experiment about unbanning perma banned players and see how they have reformed.  I feel like perma baning is such a rough punishment, especially since i wasnt using any racist, homophobic slurs and such. My last game, i told somebody they didnt have any brain cells cuz he kept telling me to die and boom instant perma banned.  Ive been toxic before but the worst ive said was along the lines of calling people stupid and bad at the game, and i feel like perma banning should be reserved for people who use racist or homophobic language.

replies.body:
Riot does not unban perma'd accounts. They were running a small experiment but the deadline for that has long since passed and they said do not expect it to be the norm.

> My last game, i told somebody they didnt have any brain cells cuz he kept telling me to die and boom instant perma banned.

This is incorrect. You were perma banned because you have a extensive history of punishments and still chose to not change your ways. You weren't perma'd for one single incident. You were perma'd for a long history of them

i was talking about my LAST game, what I said.  I said that because i was trying to say i feel as tho there is a lot worse things that can be said.  I got banned for 14 days at first for saying certain trigger words like "%%%, r%%%%% etc"  but ever since that ban I have never said anything like that, my only flames were calling people bad or dumb, sticking to simple vocabs.  Considering how people say things like "die" or "I will kill your family", I feel like my level of toxicity shouldnt have been perma banned worthy

> [{quoted}](name=CustomSupremeVL,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tfThbPjV,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-01-10T05:39:38.914+0000)
>

I got banned for 14 days at first for saying certain trigger words like "%%%, r%%%%% etc"  but ever since that ban I have never said anything like that, my only flames were calling people bad or dumb, sticking to simple vocabs.  Considering how people say things like "die" or "I will kill your family", I feel like my level of toxicity shouldnt have been perma banned worthy

And we're telling you that you don't get permabanned for your LAST game. You get permabanned by being consistently unpleasant with no evidence of improving your behavior to the standards outlined in the ToS.

ok you are completely missing my point. fine ignore that last game part.  my point is yeah i still call people bad and stuff, but ever since my 14 day ban, I have stopped being really toxic.  Also, I rarely started toxicity, it usually starts when i make a comment on a dumb play like " why would you do that" no flame whatsoever, and if they reply stfu or some other toxic shit thats when my toxicity begins.  its almost always a response.  Now im not gna use that as an excuse because i shouldnt have responded to toxicity with more toxicity but the fact still remains i MADE SURE to not be extremely toxic but because Ive been put on a system thats almost impossible to climb out of, league banned me for "toxicity" that happens almost every game.

> [{quoted}](name=CustomSupremeVL,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tfThbPjV,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-10T08:01:17.349+0000)

Also, I rarely started toxicity, it usually starts when i make a comment on a dumb play like " why would you do that" no flame whatsoever, and if they reply stfu or some other toxic shit thats when my toxicity begins.  its almost always a response.  Now im not gna use that as an excuse because i shouldnt have responded to toxicity with more toxicity but the fact still remains i MADE SURE to not be extremely toxic but because Ive been put on a system thats almost impossible to climb out of, league banned me for "toxicity" that happens almost every game.

"i still call people bad and stuff" even though Riot told you to stop or else they'd permaban you, and that's what happened. It doesn't matter who started it. It doesn't matter that your behavior could theoretically have been worse. It wasn't good enough, you were warned multiple times, and Riot put a stop to it.

Well, you break the rules, you get punished according to those rules. 
Sorry mate, but that experiment has already ended. I don't think you are getting this account back.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tfThbPjV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-09T22:48:57.258+0000)
>
> Well, you break the rules, you get punished according to those rules. 
> Sorry mate, but that experiment has already ended. I don't think you are getting this account back.

Could you provide a link stating that the experiment has ended?
I've been searching for news about this experiment, and i think you're providing bad info.
I've been talking with Riot employees and they've told me that they don't know more than us, but they said that the experiment is still ongoing!

> do anyone think Riot will unban people like me at some random time? I read somewhere that riot did some experiment about unbanning perma banned players and see how they have reformed

Likely not. Riot is still analyzing the data from the experiment, but I remember reading about that most toxic players had not reformed, and simply went back to their toxic ways once they got their accounts back for use. We will have to wait for Riot's data on the experiment.

>  I feel like perma baning is such a rough punishment, especially since i wasnt using any racist, homophobic slurs and such

To be honest, you had plenty of chances to change your behavior between punishments and yet you chose not to.

> My last game, i told somebody they didnt have any brain cells cuz he kept telling me to die and boom instant perma banned

You likely had a 14-day ban previous to this one? After that you don't even need to say anything extremely toxic, that is kind of like standing on thin ice. 14-day ban is the last warning and after that even milder amounts of toxicity/negativity can warrant a permaban. You should've just muted the dude who was telling you to die etc. And the last game only was the nail in your coffin, but your continuous bad behavior was the reason for your permaban.

It's insane to make mild negativity warrant a permaban after the 14-day ban. This only traps people in a snowball which makes them feel negative. I've never seen any other game have the issues Riot has and they make their own some of the time. This hyper aggression toward random people doesn't help the toxic environment.

> [{quoted}](name=TheRealAryaStark,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tfThbPjV,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-01-11T10:30:23.800+0000)
>
> It's insane to make mild negativity warrant a permaban after the 14-day ban. This only traps people in a snowball which makes them feel negative. I've never seen any other game have the issues Riot has and they make their own some of the time. This hyper aggression toward random people doesn't help the toxic environment.

But the thing is people are given multiple chances to reform. The 14-day ban literally states that if you still continue to work against the rules, you will be permabanned. People should realize that their actions aren't tolerable, be it minor **or** harsh toxicity.
